prompt:
How should you approach writing a review for a book you recently read?
When writing reviews for books you’ve just read, always consider your audience – are they interested primarily in plot or character development; do they want recommendations based on genre preference (like science fiction vs. historical fiction)? Make sure to address these concerns while also mentioning what made the book stand out among others within its category and why it deserves praise over other similar publications currently available on shelves today.
